meanings.definition: The state or condition of being wet.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the wetnesses of the ground made it muddy.
meanings.sent2: She could feel the wetnesses of the ocean water on her skin.
meanings.sent3: The wetnesses of the spilled juice made the floor slippery.
meanings.sent4: The wetnesses of his tears reflected his sadness.
meanings.sent5: The wetnesses of the morning dew glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The quality or characteristic of being wet.
meanings.sent1: The wetnesses of the fabric indicated it had just been washed.
meanings.sent2: The wetnesses of the paint made it difficult to touch up the wall.
meanings.sent3: The wetnesses of the dog's fur after a bath made it fluffy.
meanings.sent4: The wetnesses of the fresh paint filled the room with a strong smell.
meanings.sent5: The wetnesses of the morning mist enveloped the entire valley.
